description.h2: An instance covering a reporting period must contain a Required Context that is an xbrli:context having xbrli:startDate equal to 00:00:00 on the first day of the reporting period and xbrli:endDate equal to 24:00:00 on its last day.
description.p: This rule defines "Required Context". For example, this rule applies to a filing such as a Form 10-Q for the last calendar quarter of 2009, with xbrli:startDate equal to '2009-10-01' and xbrli:endDate equal to '2009-12-31'.
Many submissions require a second Required Context, see 6.5.21 below. Required contexts are distinguished by having no xbrli:segment elements.
REMARK: The absence of required context will cause several other errors in section 6.5, this has a separate error code to help users identify the root error of the cascade.

REMARK: At this point there is only one distinction, between 485BPOS and 497 which require a one day duration, and all other filings having any duration. At some point in the future the ERXL table will be extended to include columns that indicate the allowable range of durations, for example:

variation.name: 6.5.19 Contexts in 10K, none of which have all default segments, NOGOOD.
variation.description: Contexts in in 10K, NOGOOD, none of which have default segments.

variation.name: 6.5.19 One day context in 485BPOS, which has no 'reporting period', GOOD
variation.description: One day context in 485BPOS, which has no 'reporting period', GOOD

variation.name: 6.5.19 One day context in Other (stand in for 497), which has no 'reporting period', GOOD
variation.description: One day context in Other (stand in for 497), which has no 'reporting period', GOOD

variation.name: 6.5.19 Full period context in 10K, DEI 2009, GOOD
variation.description: Full period context in 10K, DEI 2009, GOOD
